$NVDA  $AMD  
Both of these premier companies (products, franchise, balance sheets, ebitda/eps, & mgmt superiority) have been hammered as if they are weak sauce meme names. ya, almost down to market multiples while generating rev/eps growth seriously higher than S&P 500/competitors. 
 
Then Barron's (dipshit writer) publishes a hit piece this weekend. I wrote an extensive thrashback, but if you read the article, it is clear they don't understand crypto's lack of importance for NVDA, or the used gpu market, or that NVDA now has new lower priced cards for the budget conscious.  Nor does the tard understand that serious gamers will always want the best cards NVDA can put out as failing to upgrade means they cant compete w/the best gamers who do so.   
 
Funniest part is there was no mention of the Grace dual CPUs coming in early 2023; worldwide domination of data center system coming on this new platform for NVDA, nor any of their positioning in AI, autos, deep learning, edge, or big data
